steps.title: Launch & onboarding
details: All scenarios start by loading http://localhost:5173 successfully.

steps.title: Create a task (core flow)
details: Fills in fields, but ‘Create Task’ button is often blocked by the still-open category dropdown (z-index / focus bug).
Result: timeout – task never created; no success toast.

steps.title: Move / reorder task
details: Flow never executed because previous task was not created.

steps.title: Edit, complete, favourite & pin
details: When task does exist, edit / complete / favourite generally works but user must scroll to find save buttons.
Visual indicators (strikethrough, star fill, pin icon) are subtle; users look for confirmation.

steps.title: Category management
details: Adding a new category (‘Hobby’) appears to work, but list never refreshes – user concludes it failed.
Editing a category (rename & colour) works after multiple clicks; UI feedback is minimal.

steps.title: Share task (link / QR / calendar)
details: Share dialog opens but link copy / QR download / .ics export are unreliable – repeated retries, manual right-click to download. No confirmation messages.

steps.title: Settings – Appearance
details: User can cycle through themes & motion settings, but some options (‘Auto’ dark mode, disable glow) never register.
No global toast confirming preference saved.

steps.title: Install PWA
details: Tester cannot find an ‘Install App’ prompt – flow dead-ends.

steps.title: Logout
details: Logout button clicked, redirected, but no explicit ‘You are logged out’ message.

emotional_arc: Excited on first load → mild confusion in modal (lots of fields) → sharp frustration when ’Create Task’ button won’t respond → uncertainty due to lack of success messages → relief when tasks eventually appear → annoyance at visual clutter / mis-aligned UI → distrust when share/download features don’t work → fatigue after many retries.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Primary CTA (‘Create Task’) is unusable when category popover sits above it – users think the app is broken.
next_actions: Close popover on selection or click outside.
Add z-index/ pointer-events:none to menu when modal expects submission.
Add E2E test specifically for this regression.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent typography, spacing and button styling makes the product feel unpolished and lowers trust.
next_actions: Create a single Button component for all variants; replace ad-hoc buttons.
Audit font sizes/weights; set global heading & body styles.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users don’t know if actions succeeded (task added, category saved, logout, share link copied).
next_actions: Emit Snackbar/Toast on all CRUD and share actions.
Display inline icon changes (filled star, checkmark) with small micro-animations.
Add empty-state and success-state copy for clarity.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Three-dot menus hide important functions; testers scour UI, causing friction.
next_actions: Surface high-value actions (Share, Pin) as icons directly on card for desktop widths.
Introduce guided onboarding for new users.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Multiple reports of low contrast and unclear colour tokens – affects readability and WCAG compliance.
next_actions: Run automated contrast audit; adjust palette.
Add focus outlines for keyboard nav.

first_tackles.description: Fix popover/overlay bug that blocks ‘Create Task’ (close on selection & adjust z-index).
Add universal toast/snackbar component for success & error states (task created, category saved, link copied, etc.).
Standardise Button component styling and apply across modals, dialogs and menus.
Implement spacing / padding token system to eliminate inconsistent gaps quickly.
Run quick colour-contrast pass on primary text & button states to hit WCAG AA.
